interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Angelina Ballerina - The Lucky Penny
Review Date: 2019/06/09
Store: Finty Williams  (Actor),     Judi Dench  (Actor),     Kitty Taylor  (Director),     Roger McIntosh  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles
Product Description: ['When Angelina finds a lucky penny, she decides she doesn\x92t need to practice for an important audition. But when she loses the penny, she realizes that practice makes perfect after all. With Angelina\x92s support, Alice enters a gymnastics championship and learns to persevere as she overcomes her fear of the balance beam. Angelina also lends a helping hand to her new friend, Anya, a harvest mouse who is down on her luck, and to her grandpa as she searches for his lost war medal. It\x92s a lucky day for everyone in Angelina Ballerina: The Lucky Penny!']
Average Rating: 4.2
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Music Videos & Concerts', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Finty Williams, Lucy Raby, Kitty Taylor, Paul Larson, Katharine Holabird, Jo Wyatt, Judi Dench, Keith Wickham, Roger McIntoshFinty Williams, Lucy Raby, Kitty Taylor, Paul Larson, Katharine Holabird, Jo Wyatt, Judi Dench, Keith Wickham, Roger McIntosh   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '1', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.75 inches; 4.48 Ounces', 'Director': 'Kitty Taylor, Roger McIntosh', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '55 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 15, 2003', 'Actors': 'Finty Williams, Judi Dench, Keith Wickham, Jo Wyatt', 'Studio': 'Universal Studios Home Entertainment', 'Writers': 'Katharine Holabird, Lucy Raby, Paul Larson', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Very cute for 3 y old baby.
Review Title: Adorable & sweet for my baby
Rating: 5.0

Tom Cruse is a really bad actor -))) Very slow and boring.... {'Content advisory': ['Alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Pulcini'], 'Producers': ['Richard Gladstein'], 'Starring': ['Scarlett Johansson', 'Laura Linney', 'Alicia Keys'], 'Studio': ['Lions Gate Films', 'Inc.']} This movie is exactly how life is behind the closed doors of rich families in NYC...
I was AuPair (foreign nanny) for over a year and this movie was like 90% of my life 10 year ago... I also had a boy and he was 7 y old...and we had a peanut butter from the jar (only no double dipping lol)
I also was fired because my "host mom" became jealous of kid's love towards me...He started to call me my mommy and the best friend. I tried to explain him the difference, BUT he said..mommy is who takes care of you and loves you, and you the only person who is....
I guess nothing else to add....Nanny cam and I was fired...
So many similarities in a movie...omg...
Anyway, the best part is I met my hubby. He also lived almost "next door"..and "my host mom" did not like our relationship, saying he is out of my class....
Now I am happily married for almost 8 years and became a doctor. Still live in NY next door to my EX-"host mom" -)))) Exactly how life is behind closed doors of rich families in NYC Angelina Ballerina - The Lucky Penny Finty Williams (Actor), Judi Dench (Actor), Kitty Taylor (Director), Roger McIntosh (Director) & 1 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Universal Studios Home Entertainment, All Universal Studios Titles ['When Angelina finds a lucky penny, she decides she doesn\x92t need to practice for an important audition. But when she loses the penny, she realizes that practice makes perfect after all. With Angelina\x92s support, Alice enters a gymnastics championship and learns to persevere as she overcomes her fear of the balance beam. Angelina also lends a helping hand to her new friend, Anya, a harvest mouse who is down on her luck, and to her grandpa as she searches for his lost war medal. profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user remains focused on engaging content about food and agriculture, particularly supporting local farmers, and emphasizes health and sustainable living. Their recent purchase of a juicer and continued interest in documentaries reflect this commitment.

- **Rating Behavior:** Following a recent 5.0 rating for a relatable film, the user’s average rating stands at 4.4. Their critical approach to content is evident, having rated a slow film 2.0 and a dull film 1.0, contrasting with their enjoyment of a quirky film rated 5.0. This illustrates a discriminating taste shaped by personal experiences.

- **Language & Accessibility:** The user favors English language options and values accessibility features like audio descriptions and closed captions, which enhance their viewing experiences.

- **Interest in Documentaries:** Their strong focus on social and ecological themes in documentaries persists, alongside health and sustainability interests.

- **Producers and Directors:** They favor reputable producers and directors and remain open to critique low-quality content.

- **Social Responsibility:** The user’s commitment to social responsibility emphasizes support for local communities and a thoughtful evaluation of content.

Overall, the user enjoys high-quality, relatable content that connects with their passions, showcasing an evolving rating approach shaped by diverse viewing experiences while also appreciating family-friendly, engaging entertainment for younger audiences.
